entry.title: Allow WebAudio FIFO size to match callback buffer if it is very large
entry.content:
The Web Audio FIFO is over-allocated to allow for growing if there are

buffer xruns. However, on some Android devices there is a very large

callback buffer which will fail a CHECK. Just match the callback

buffer size in this case, to avoid crashing.

entry.title: Remove //chrome/tools/build/chromeos/
entry.content:
These files are presumed to be old & unused.



When building a new CrOS image, the CrOS release builders use this

script to scrape together the list of files packed into the image:

https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:chromite/scripts/deploy_chrome.py



And that script builds its list of files via:

https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:chromite/lib/chrome_util.py



So nothing in //chrome/tools/build/chromeos/ should be read by that

process.



As for lacros, it currently uses:

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/infra/archive_config/lacros64-archive-rel.json



So it should be safe to delete these old config files.



Bug: None

Change-Id: I398b8088df41dbee70a531975961b80579819904

entry.title: [view-transition] Re-enable
entry.content:
NewContentTimeoutIsSetWhenLeavingBFCacheWithViewTransition



Removing the pixel comparison should make the test stable. Looking at

the flaky history [1], they all failed because of the pixel comparison.



TLDR: depending on when the screenshot request is served in viz

(pre/post VT animation), the content of the screenshot can be either

green (fallback surface) or red (primary surface). The reasons of

failure are documented in https://crbug.com/40278487.

entry.title: views: fix focus ring invisible issue in LayoutManagerBase
entry.content:
FocusRing was not laid out by LayoutManagerBase because it reports a zero preferred size. This patch marks FocusRing as a "decorative view",

such that:



* it has the View property kIsDecorativeViewKey set to true.

* its visibility is respcted by LayoutManagerBase. i.e. the layout

manager's proposed visibility is disregarded.

* its Layout() is always invoked during layout.



Bug: b/325029896

entry.title: Remove View::GetClassName overrides
entry.content:
Metadata macros already create a GetClassName function. For classes

that already implement metadata GetClassName is not needed especially

since most of the time the returned classname is the same as the macro

version. Remove these overrides. For classes that do not have

metadata implemented, implement metadata and then remove overrides.



- Nested classes will be prefixed with the outer class name

- Places that used IsClassName to check for the corect object will use

IsViewClass instead



The following classes will have the class name changed in order to

standardize the class names through metadata



ShelfAppButton

original: ash/ShelfAppButton

new: ShelfAppButton



NotificationListView::MessageViewContainer

original: MessageViewContainer

new: NotificationListView::MessageViewContainer



TaskContinuationView::TaskChipsView

original: TaskChipsView

new: TaskContinuationView::TaskChipsView



PowerButtonMenuScreenView::PowerButtonMenuBackgroundView

original: PowerButtonMenuBackgroundView

new: PowerButtonMenuScreenView::PowerButtonMenuBackgroundView



StatusAreaWidgetDelegate

original: ash/StatusAreaWidgetDelegate

new: StatusAreaWidgetDelegate



Bug: 5287851

Change-Id: I674959d00d09a09df297684d70103dbc76ab46a8

entry.title: [ios] Remove early return with WouldTriggerHelpUI and shouldForce check.
entry.content:
The pro of the early return is not to execute code (setting up view

controller, check more conditions for potentially showing the IPH)

that ends up doing nothing, saving resources.



The con is WouldTriggerHelpUI doesn't log failure reasons, like

ShouldTriggerHelpUI does. When early return, `ShouldTriggerHelpUI` will

always be executed in successful cases, hence we lose the failure reason

buckets that `ShouldTriggerHelpUI` logs, which can be helpful in further

improving the product definition.



There should be no change in feature behaviors as we always call

ShouldTriggerHelpUI as the last check before showing the IPH.



Bug: 40265763



Change-Id: I407c69478d5d344373e115e75def16cafce77f98

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5296595

Reviewed-by: Ginny Huang

entry.title: [views-a11y] Clip text range bounds to Textfield bounds
entry.content:
When we return the bounds of a text range within a Textfield element,

we need to clip the bounds of said text range to the bounds of the

Textfield. Otherwise, the rectangle that gets rendered by screen

readers and other ATs will go beyond the bounds of the Textfield and

won't match the visual appearance.



Fixed: 324519304

It also also switches between `AuthenticationDialog` based

implementation of in session dialog and `AuthPanel` based

implementation depending on feature flag state.

entry.title: [segmentation] Revert signal database cache
entry.content:
The cache causes memory regression for new models, when there are

a lot of histograms.



Reverts https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4875307



- Add a feature flag for the signal database cache, only enable on iOS.

- Change GetSignals() to return entries that can be used by aggregator.

- Process UMA features by reading each signal from the database.

- Remove the signal cache when feature flag is disabled.

entry.title: [views_ax] Move DCHECK and AXNodeData merge logic to end of function
entry.content:
ViewAccessibility::GetAccessibleNodeData is home to 4 different ways

of setting accessibility attributes for Views:

- View::SetAccessibleAttribute

- ViewAccessible::OverrideAttribute

- View::GetAccessibleNodeData

- Final state adjustements at the end of the function



With the ViewsAX project, we added a fifth way (and final) way.

The goal of this last system is to allow us to remove all other 4 systems. This is an iterative approach, where we'll migrate attribute

by attribute. In order to ensure that Views author do not introduce

any regressions by using one of the older 4 systems to after we

completed the migration for a specific attribute, we need to run

a DCHECK that iterates over all properties set before we apply the

ones coming from the new system to confirm it hasn't been set.



For this reason, this code absolutely needs to be the last step of

the entire ViewAccessibility::GetAccessibleNodeData.

entry.title: Avoid assuming string_view iterators are char*
entry.content:
Fix code that makes this assumption to:

- use data() instead of begin() to get a char*, or

- to properly work with iterators as iterators, or

- to use string_view substrs instead of iterators.



libc++ will at some point make them no longer char* to avoid code

existing like this. These assumptions prevent us from using bounded

iterators in libc++.

entry.title: [realbox][grouping] Update DesktopSecondaryNTPZpsSection Groups.
entry.content:
Allow for contextual and trending text suggestions to be shown in the

second column of the NTP realbox.



Removes DCHECK that ensures that all Groups in a Section have the same SideType. Instead, there is a new check that returns a past-the-end iterator if an AutocompleteMatch cannot be shown in a Section based on the match's suggestion_group_id & Section side types.



Contextual suggestions in 2nd column:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/K8R8dZvcbXWg4Yv



Trending suggestions in 2nd column:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8Bk4k7swueaazNj

entry.title: Roll libxml from f19a9510 to c444c96e
entry.content:
This CL adds an additional patch on top of libxml which

removes calls to getentropy() and BCryptGetRandom() because they

aren't implemented or supported on certain platforms based on the trybot

results I saw. I will try upstreaming a configure script flag soon to replace

this patch file. This patch is safe because it reverts the random number

generation behavior before a recent libxml upstream patch.

> [//gpu][mac] Support multiple concurrent read access in Graphite

entry.title: [Tab Groups] add Token-based ID support behind flag
entry.content:
Add and manage Token-based TabGroupIds for Tabs in TabGroupModelFilter.



RootId must be the TabId of one of the tabs in the group. This is

unstable because if the Tab with the TabId corresponding to the RootId

of the group is removed from the group the group must elect a new

TabId from among its tabs to be the new RootId. This leads to issues

with managing the state of a tab group over time.



Under the RootId paradigm every tab was associated with a TabGroup

object and only tab groups with > 1 tab were considered "real" tab

groups. In an effort to support tab groups with a single tab it is

necessary to come up with a new approach.



This CL introduces TabGroupId. This ID is stable in that it is tied

to the group the tabs are in and can only be destroyed if all tabs

are removed from the tab group OR two groups with TabGroupIds are

merged resulting in one of the two TabGroupIds going away.



Tabs only have a TabGroupId if they are associated with a "real"

tab group of size 1 or larger. Otherwise this field will be null.

This means that TabGroup objects will only contain tabs with a

TabGroupId if the group is > size 1 OR that single tab is to be

treated as a real tab group.



If the flag AndroidTabGroupStableIds is enabled then after

tab state initialization all tabs that are part of "real" tab

groups under the old definition will be allocated TabGroupIds

in a 1:1 manner with old RootIds. When the flag is disabled

the TabGroupIds will all be reset instead.



Logic for maintaining TabGroupIds is as follows:

* A Tab Group Id is allocated when:

* A single tab is turned into a single tab group.

* A single tab is merged with another single tab to form a

group.

* A list of tabs is merged to a single tab to form a group.

If a group is merged to a single tab its Tab Group Id is

preserved.

* Tab Group Ids are removed from tabs when:

* Ungrouping a tab from a group.

* Tab Group Ids are lost entirely when:

* Merging two tab groups both with tab group ids (only one ID will

continue to exist).

* Removing the last tab from a group.

* Deleting an entire tab group.

entry.title: Add feature flags for client certificates copying from Nss DB to Chaps
entry.content:
Add new feature flags to control client certificates migration from

the NSS DB to the software backed Chaps storage. Feature flag

kEnableNssDbRollback controls rollback from the software backed

Chaps storage to NSS DB, it will activate a rollback routine which

will delete all migrated or dual written client certificates and

keys from the software backed Chaps storage, but keeps copies of

keys and certificates in the the NSS DB.

kEnableNssDbRollback needs to be enabled in case when

rollback is required, by default it is disabled.

Feature flag kEnablePkcs12ToChapsDualWrite controls import of PKCS12

files to software backed Chaps storage. When the feature is disabled,

"Import" button on chrome://settings/certificates page will import

PKCS12 file into NSS DB, when the feature is enabled the "Import"

button on chrome://settings/certificates page will import PKCS12

file to the NSS DB and to the software backed Chaps storage

together. By default the feature is disabled.



Bug: 264390190

entry.title: [SAA] Implementing SharedWorker support (Part 4: Add SharedWorker support to SAA handle)
entry.content:
The Storage Access API provides access to unpartitioned cookies in

third-party contexts. This CL is part of a series to extend that access

to SharedWorkers.



This CL implements the final component, SharedWorker access via the SAA

handle itself. Prior CLs set up the proper cookie filtering we test here

to ensure no third-party context can access SameSite=Lax/Strict cookies

(even if they can access unpartitioned SameSite=None cookies).



Design Doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/19qCGb4qwOcGiNrQM3ptWvRmB4JtpaTFgFVlWLXNOQ6c/edit



Explainer:

https://privacycg.github.io/saa-non-cookie-storage/shared-workers.html



Part 1: Expose same-site cookie IPC

Part 2: Expose same-site cookie IDL

Part 3: Implement same-site cookie filtering

Part 4: Add SharedWorker support to SAA handle

entry.title: ash: Fix and re-enable TrayItemViewTest smoothness tests
entry.content:
A few issues fixed:

- `widget_` from `CreateFramelessTestWidget` has size 0 so UI

changes are not actually drawn. And v3 does not count

`did-not-produce-frame` as expected frames. So smoothness

metrics are not reported. This is fixed by assigning a size

to `widget_`.

- In the animation interruption tests, visibility animations

are happening too quickly and end up as a no-op.

For example, in HideSmoothnessMetricRecordedWhenHideInterruptsShow,

Ui goes from `false` -> `true` -> `false`. But there is no actual

opacity change because test does not wait for the intermediate show

animation to progress a bit. This is fixed by waiting for

opacity change before starting the 2nd animation.

- Wait for compositor to generate one frame before starting tests

so that UI changes are picked up in time and generating smoothness

metrics.



Re-enable the following TrayItemViewTest tests:

- TrayItemViewTest.SmoothnessMetricRecordedForHideAnimation

- TrayItemViewTest.SmoothnessMetricRecordedForShowAnimation

- TrayItemViewTest.HideSmoothnessMetricRecordedWhenHideInterruptsShow

- TrayItemViewTest.ShowSmoothnessMetricRecordedWhenShowInterruptsHide



Bug: chromium:41496872

entry.title: Assign process_id for TerminalParams::ForNonNetwork
entry.content:
Follow-up of a previous CL:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5280621



The previous CL caused crbug.com/324679506

probably because it changed the process ID plumbed from

`ForNonNetwork` cases in `NavigationURLLoaderImpl` to

`URLLoaderInterceptor::InterceptorCallback()`

from `kBrowserProcessId` into `kInvalidProcessId`,

which changed threads to be used there.

This CL restores the process ID in `NavigationURLLoaderImpl`

(and thus the thread to be used for `URLLoaderInterceptor`)

by plumbing `kBrowserProcessId` explicitly.



This CL also plumbs process_id for other `ForNonNetwork` cases based on

`URLLoaderFactoryParams::process_id` in related code locations.



Bug: 1506871, 324458368, 324679506

entry.title: base: convert 0-length java.nio.Buffer to valid span
entry.content:
Previously, base::android::JavaByteBufferToSpan and friends would reject

these buffers, but it actually makes more sense to consider them as

valid but empty spans, since they are valid (but zero-length) Buffers.



This problem was flushed out by a couple of the WebContentsState tests

while that code was being span-ified, but this change adds a new test to

cover this behavior.

dangling pointer in the overview focus cycler.



Crash repro steps:

- Enter overview with two desks.

- Tab until the desk profile button is focused.

- Use mouse to close the desk.

- Press tab.

entry.title: immersive fullscreen: fix tab hover card dismissal
entry.content:
With cr23 enabled tab hover cards are not dismissed when the omnibox

results window is visible. The size changes associated with cr23 seem

cause HitTestPoint on the tab widget to miss when close to its bottom

edge (maybe a rounding error?). This causes the tab to miss mouse events

that would trigger a hover card dismissal.



This CL fixes this issue by routing more mouse events to the tab widget

where appropriate.

entry.title: [Autofill] Rewrite CreditCardBenefit class hierarchy with absl::variant
entry.content:
This CL turns the CreditCard{,FlatRate,Category,Merchant}Benefit

hierarchy into a variant of types:

- CreditCardBenefit is now called CreditCardBenefitBase and has no

virtual functions anymore. CreditCard{FlatRate,Category,Merchant}

derive from it.

- CreditCardBenefit is an absl::variant with the alternatives

CreditCard{FlatRate,Category,Merchant}.



This CL doesn't introduce any wrapper functions. They seem not to be

needed yet.



An unexpected challenge was the comparison operator:

CreditCard{FlatRate,Category,Merchant}::operator==() is now defaulted.

That requires a CreditCardBenefitBase::operator==(), which should not

be public to avoid surprising behaviour. This doesn't work by default

(https://godbolt.org/z/cKh6KWsG6), but it can be fixed with additional

friendships (https://godbolt.org/z/aKno5TMba). I don't see how

https://timsong-cpp.github.io/cppwp/n4868/class.compare#class.eq-2

implies this.



Bug: 324973797

Change-Id: I949a6abdd49df4cc189fbc77e6378c855828ebb4

entry.title: Remove ExpectSameElements() from ADM tests
entry.content:
The function tests if two vector of AutofillProfile* contain the same

unordered elements, when comparing the elements using Compare().



1) Turns out using Compare() is unnecessarily restrictive. The tests

pass operator==, which compares GUIDs, use dates and Compare()

(operator== is what the PDM should be testing, since after reloading

from the database, GUIDs and metadata should be preserved).

2) Comparing profiles against a vector of pointers can be done using

EXPECT_THAT(vector-of-pointeres, UnorderedElementsAre(Pointee(...)));

This pattern is already used in some of the newer tests.



Bug: b/322170538

entry.title: Add notifyEvent API for fenced frames.
entry.content:
This API allows DOM events that occur within a fenced frame

to be observed by the frame's embedder in a privacy-respecting manner.

When an eligible event type (currently, just click) occurs within

the embedded document, window.fence.notifyEvent(e) can be called

with the event object, which will create a censored version of

the event to be handled by the embedder via addEventListener().



This API is being implemented as part of the "fenced frames with

local unpartitioned data access" proposal, see explainer here:

https://github.com/WICG/fenced-frame/blob/master/explainer/fenced_frames_with_local_unpartitioned_data_access.md



Design doc for this CL is here:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1EiysMPnARSx2pzI1hSeFlI7k2ETxs5ycZoV2Cy08PEk/edit?usp=sharing



Bug: 1515579

entry.title: firmware_update: Add progress testing to interactive UI test
entry.content:
This CL updates the Firmware Updates interactive UI test to include

the intermediate step of showing progress before the update finishes.



To accomplish this, this CL adds three "ForTesting" member functions to

fwupd_client.h, each of which give more control to the test to

update the state of the app.



This CL also creates a new implementation of abstract class

FwupdProperties called FwupdPropertiesFake that allows us to directly

control the values that are stored. This way, we can pass values

to FirmwareUpdateManager directly without needing a Dbus Object Proxy.



Test: interactive_ui_tests --gtest_filter=*FirmwareUpdateInteractiveUi*

entry.title: Add build_with_v8_embedder build override variable
entry.content:
V8 builds need the ability to distinguish when V8 is being built

standalone vs. embedded by another target. Using just

`build_with_chromium` as such an indicator is insufficient, as there can

be other embedders besides Chromium, such as PDFium.



Introduce a build override variable is a first step towards decoupling

this tie directly with Chromium. It will be followed by V8 utilizing

the override variable, and finally by any other embedders (like PDFium)

being able to set that in their builds.



Bug: pdfium:2124

entry.title: [VCN] Start Auth Flow for Virtual Cards
entry.content:
In this CL I modified

CreditCardAccessManager::StartAuthenticationFlow()

to reach CreditCardAccessManager::StartAuthenticationFlowForVirtualCard() or

CreditCardAccessManager::StartAuthenticationFlowForMaskedServerCard()

depending on the card RecordType.

There is no authentication dialog or progress bar just yet so there is no user-visible change.



TESTS

CreditCardAccessManagerTest:RiskBasedVirtualCardUnmasking_Success_VirtualCardsEnabled

- Enabled feature flag, but since this test uses a test

RiskBasedAuthenticationManager, all this proves is that the new code

didn't break anything.



CreditCardAccessManagerTest:RiskBasedVirtualCardUnmasking_Success_VirtualCardsDisabled

- The previous test without the flag enabled, just again proves that

with the flag off the code modification still does not break anything,

perhaps overkill.



CreditCardAccessManagerTest:RiskBasedVirtualCardUnmasking_AuthenticationRequired_OtpOnly

CreditCardAccessManagerTest:RiskBasedVirtualCardUnmasking_AuthenticationRequired_CvcOnly

CreditCardAccessManagerTest:RiskBasedVirtualCardUnmasking_only3dsChallengeReturned

CreditCardAccessManagerTest:RiskBasedVirtualCardUnmasking_AuthenticationRequired_OtpAndCvcAnd3ds

- These are now functional for iOS with the kEnableVirtualCards flag on

since the RiskBasedAuthenticator is reached and can return the different challenge options.



Bug: b/323506332
